Description: THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE OF PARKS, RECREATION AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION (NYS OPRHP) IS POSITIONED TO PURCHASE TWO PARCELS OF LAND WITHIN THE HUDSON HIGHLANDS REGION IN COOPERATION WITH THE HIGHLANDS CONSERVATION ACT GRANT PROGRAM.NYS OPRHP S ACQUISITION OF THE FIRST PROPERTY AS AN ADDITION TO HUDSON HIGHLANDS STATE PARK PRESERVE IS A KEY ACCOMPLISHMENT FOR THIS PROJECT. THE PROPERTY IS A 26    ACRE PARCEL LOCATED IN THE CITY OF FISHKILL, DUTCHESS COUNTY, STATE OF NEW YORK. THE PROPERTY BUFFERS HUDSON HIGHLANDS STATE PARK PRESERVE LANDS TO THE NORTH, SOUTH, AND EAST. THE PROPERTY LIES ADJACENT TO SEVERAL THOUSAND ACRES OF PUBLIC PARKLANDS BELONGING TO THE NEW YORK STATE AND IS VISIBLE FROM NUMEROUS PORTIONS OF SAID LAND. THE PROPERTY IS CHARACTERIZED BY ITS WALK IN CAMPGROUND, WOODLANDS, STEEP HILLSIDES, A PERENNIAL STREAM, INTERMITTENT STREAMS, AND NATURAL BEAUTY. THE PROPERTY IS PART OF THE HUDSON HIGHLANDS AND WITHIN THE WATERSHED OF THE HUDSON RIVER, LONG RECOGNIZED FOR ITS OUTSTANDING SCENIC AND NATURAL BEAUTY, SHORELINE, AND GEOLOGICAL AND ECOLOGICAL CHARACTER, THE PRESERVATION OF WHICH IS SIGNIFICANT TO THE REGION S NATURAL, HISTORICAL, ARCHAEOLOGICAL, ARCHITECTURAL, RECREATIONAL, AND CULTURAL AMENITIES. A ROCKY PERENNIAL STREAM BISECTS THE PROPERTY, RUNNING ROUGHLY NORTH ON ITS WAY TO FISHKILL CREEK A QUARTER MILE AWAY. FISHKILL CREEK IS A TRIBUTARY TO THE HUDSON RIVER. SEVERAL INTERMITTENT STREAMS RUN NORTH AND NORTHWEST AND ARE ALSO PART OF THE HUDSON RIVER WATERSHED.THE SECOND TRACT IS AN 88    ACRE PARCEL LOCATED IN THE TOWN OF TUXEDO, ORANGE COUNTY, STATE OF NEW YORK. NYS OPRHP IS COMMITTED TO SUCCESSFULLY ACQUIRING THE TRACT AS A VALUABLE ADDITION TO STERLING FOREST STATE PARK. IN DOING SO, THE INTEGRITY OF THE CONSERVED LANDSCAPE WILL BE PRESERVED. THE PROPERTY IS SITUATED BETWEEN STERLING FOREST STATE PARK TO THE WEST, AND CONSERVATION LANDS OWNED BY THE TOWN OF TUXEDO TO THE EAST. ACQUISITION WILL PROTECT THE PROPERTY AND MAINTAIN CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN SURROUNDING PROTECTED LANDS. THIS PROJECT WILL PRESERVE CONNECTIONS THAT ARE IMPORTANT FOR CLIMATE RESILIENCE INCLUDING THE NORTH SOUTH CONNECTION FROM STERLING FOREST, THROUGH TOWN OF TUXEDO CONSERVATION LANDS TO HARRIMAN STATE PARK, AND ELEVATIONAL CONNECTIVITY WITH LANDS TO THE SOUTH AND EAST. THE ADDED PRESERVATION AND RECREATIONAL VALUE OF THESE ACRES ARE OF GREAT IMPORTANCE TO THE HIGHLANDS REGION. IN ADDITION TO VITAL LINKAGE, ACQUISITION OF THE PROPERTY WILL WORK TO PRESERVE AND PROVIDE BIOLOGICAL CONNECTIVITY FOR WILDLIFE.THE PROJECT WILL ACCOMPLISH PUBLIC RECREATION OPPORTUNITY GOALS. WHEN ADDED TO STERLING FOREST STATE PARK, THE PROPERTY WILL BE OPEN TO THE PUBLIC FOR PASSIVE RECREATIONAL USE AND MANAGED IN A WAY THAT IS COMPATIBLE WITH THE PROTECTION OF ITS NATURAL RESOURCES.

THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT IS FOR THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND  ENVIRONMENTALPROTECTION (DEEP) TO ACQUIRE LAND EITHER IN FEE OR THROUGH CONSERVATION EASEMENTS TOPERMANENTLY PROTECT WATER, WILDLIFE, FOREST, AGRICULTURE, RECREATIONAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE DEEP WORKS CLOSELY WITH LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES AND LAND TRUSTS TO IDENTIFY AND PROTECT THE HIGHEST CONSERVATION VALUES WITHIN THE AREA. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE IDENTIFYING PROPERTIES OF HIGH CONSERVATION VALUE, NEGOTIATING WITH LANDOWNERS, PERFORMING DUE DILIGENCE, AND CLOSING ON PROPERTIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE PERMANENT PROTECTION OF LAND FROM DEVELOPMENT AND SUSTAINING HEALTHY AND DIVERSE ENVIRONMENTS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHO USE AND APPRECIATE THESE NATURAL RESOURCES.

THE PENNSYLVANIA HIGHLANDS REGION IS RICH IN ECOLOGICAL, RECREATIONAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. LOCATED SOUTH OF THE KITTATINNY RIDGE, IT FEATURES ROLLING GREEN HILLS, THRIVING FOREST, ROCKY TERRAIN, WETLANDS AND VALUED ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND HISTORICAL SITES. IT S A LARGE AREA CONTAINING NEARLY 1.5 MILLION ACRES, INCLUDING WILLIAM PENN STATE FOREST, FIVE STATE PARKS AND MULTIPLE STATE GAME LANDS.THE PROXIMITY TO LARGE URBAN CENTERS MEANS THAT THE AREA FACES A VERY HIGH RISK OF CONVERSION THROUGH LOSS OF HABITAT AND OPEN SPACE. THERE IS, HOWEVER, A CONCERTED EFFORT BEING MADE BY NON PROFIT GROUPS, LAND CONSERVANCIES AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES THAT RECOGNIZE THE PENNSYLVANIA HIGHLANDS AS A UNIQUE ECOLOGICAL, RECREATIONAL, AGRICULTURAL AND CULTURAL TREASURE AND ARE COMMITTED TO ITS PRESERVATION.FUNDS USED FROM THIS GRANT WILL HELP TO ACQUIRE 493 ACRES IN WEST NANTMEAL AND WALLACE TOWNSHIPS, CHESTER COUNTY FOR AN ADDITION TO THE WILLIAM PENN STATE FOREST. THIS ACQUISITION WILL PROTECT WATER RESOURCES AND ALLOW FOR INCREASED PUBLIC OUTDOOR PASSIVE RECREATION IN THE SCHUYLKILL HIGHLANDS.

THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATION AND NATURAL RESOURCES (DEPARTMENT) IS REQUESTING FUNDING FROM THE FOA F23AS00080  HIGHLANDS CONSERVATION ACT GRANT PROGRAM  CAPACITY BUILDING COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF  172,000.  AS THE LEAD STATE CONSERVATION AGENCY, THE DEPARTMENT IF AWARDED, WILL ENTER INTO A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH THE U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE TO FULFILL THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES: 1.BUILD CAPACITY OF THE DEPARTMENT AND OTHERS TO MAXIMIZE GRANT APPLICATIONS FOR HCA BASE FUNDING AND COMPETITIVE FUNDING GRANT ROUNDS. 2.BUILD CAPACITY TO SPEND HCA AWARDED GRANT FUNDS AND CLOSE PROJECTS IN A TIMELY FASHION.

THE NEW YORK STATE OFFICE OF PARKS, RECREATION, AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION (NYS OPRHP), ACTING AS LEAD STATE AGENCY, IS APPLYING FOR A ONE-TIME AWARD OF ADMINISTRATIVE FUNDING OF  172,000 WHICH WILL ALLOW THE AGENCY TO SECURE ASSISTANCE FROM THE HUDSON HIGHLANDS LAND TRUST (HHLT) TO EXPAND OUR CAPACITY  MAXIMIZE THE NUMBER OF GRANT APPLICATIONS WE SUBMIT FOR HIGHLANDS CONSERVATION ACT (HCA) BASE FUNDING AND COMPETITIVE FUNDING GRANT ROUNDS  AND SUPPORT MUNICIPALITIES IN RESPONSE TO RECENT CHANGES IN THE HCA 2022 REAUTHORIZATION.NYS OPRHP SEEKS TO SUPPLEMENT OUR EXISTING STAFF BY SECURING HELP FROM AN EXPERIENCED REGIONAL PARTNER, HHLT AS THE NEW YORK HIGHLANDS NETWORK (NYHN) COORDINATOR. THIS WILL ENSURE THAT NYS OPRHP CAN INCREASE ITS EFFICIENCY IN IDENTIFYING PROJECTS WITHIN THE HIGHLANDS REGION AND MOVING THEM THROUGH THE HCA GRANT  NYS  ACQUISITION PROCESS TO MAXIMIZE OUR HCA GRANT FUNDING.THE HUDSON HIGHLANDS LAND TRUST, INC. (HHLT) IS A NATIONALLY ACCREDITED ORGANIZATION WITH A STRONG RECORD OF ACQUISITIONS, CONSERVATION, AND STEWARDSHIP OVER ITS 34-YEAR HISTORY. HHLT ALSO FORMED AND MANAGES THE NEW YORK HIGHLANDS NETWORK (NYHN), A COALITION OF 11 LAND TRUSTS AND FIVE STATE COUNTY CITY AGENCIES. WITH THIS ONE-TIME AWARD OF ADMINISTRATIVE FUNDING, NYS OPRHP WILL SECURE HHLTS SUPPORT, AND BY EXTENSION, SUPPORT FROM NYHN MEMBERS. HHLT AND NYHN MEMBERS WILL CONTRIBUTE STAFF TIME AND, IF REQUIRED, HHLT WILL ALSO RETAIN INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS, SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASING NYS OPRHPS CAPACITY TO BRING OUR HCA PROJECTS AND GRANT MANAGEMENT TO ITS FULL POTENTIAL.

THE NEW JERSEY HIGHLANDS WATER PROTECTION AND PLANNING COUNCIL (HIGHLANDS COUNCIL) IS PROPOSING TO FUND A PROJECT WITH A CAPACITY FUNDING GRANT FROM U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE TO CREATE, ADOPT AND IMPLEMENT A RECREATION AND OPEN SPACE PLAN. THE PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY PROPERTIES IN THE NEW JERSEY HIGHLANDS REGION AND CREATE PATHWAYS TO PROPERTY ACQUISITION FOR RECREATION AND OR OPEN SPACE PURPOSES. THE RECREATION AND OPEN SPACE PLAN WILL WORK WITH FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS, DEVELOP A GIS-ESRI COMPATIBLE GEODATABASE, ESTABLISH PROPERTY METRICS FOR REGIONAL IMPORTANCE, AND DEVELOP STRATEGIES PATHWAYS FOR PROPERTY ACQUISITION. THE RECREATION AND OPEN SPACE PLAN WILL ALLOW THE HIGHLANDS COUNCIL TO BE MORE PROACTIVE IN UTILIZING GRANT FUNDING FOR PROPERTY ACQUISITION, AND WORK TO PRESERVE ECOLOGICAL RESOURCES THAT WILL BENEFIT THE HIGHLANDS COMMUNITY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS CAPACITY BUILDING COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE RESOURCES AND SUPPORT TO DEEP. THIS WILL INCREASE DEEPS ABILITY TO MAXIMIZE ITS GRANT APPLICATIONS, SPEND AWARDED GRANT FUNDS, AND CLOSE OUT HCA PROJECTS IN A TIMELY FASHION. THIS AGREEMENT WILL FOCUS ON PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, AND STAFF RESOURCES TO CT DEEP IN ORDER TO STRENGTHEN ITS ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE, IMPROVE ITS GRANT PROCESS, AND INCREASE ITS CAPACITY TO SERVE ITS TARGET MARKET.
